message:
Hi there , 
I am a senior PHP Developer with 8 yrs Exp.

i was called three days ago for a job interview i did not apply for (they get my resume from some website)

i was asked if i used joomla before and if i write code documentation  .

I told the interviewer that i did not do any previous work with joomla as i always build Platforms and big systems from scratch and Most of the Joomla Bootstapping Core is an added load i do not need specially with big traffic sites ,

the second question about documentation , i said i never wrote documentation because i was never asked to , but if i would be asked , i can do this as it is a very easy job but a time consuming. 

when the interview came to the part where i should show him my code and my previous work , he was on a hurry an he just said i will call you .

i really do not know why such people - calling themselves multi national companies - are not estimating the value of our time .. we prepared .. came in time .. postponed our duties .. why ? he could have asked by phone if i used joomla or made documentation before !!

I do not think that all PHP programmers in FACEBOOK co. or Google inc. used joomla or Done the Documentation part before .

what do you think ?

data.message: I think it's your fault for not leaving after he asked you about "Joomla"
Ahmad Abdel-Halim That's why we need a Time machine , to fix our faults :)

هي joomla مش عيب ولا حرام ولو ده في شركة كبيرة ممكن يكون اول مرة يشوف السيفي بتاعتك وقت الانترفيو

ازاى يعنى مفيش Documentation ?
طب حضرتك لما مبرمجين جداد يشتغلوا فى الشركة المفروض يفهموا الكود ازاى ؟ :)
طب حتى الــ Teamwork اللى مع حضرتك المفروض يفهموا الكود ازاى ؟
لو حضرتك سبت الشركة لاي سبب من الاسباب المفروض صاحب الشركة يجيب منجمين يحللوا الكود مثلا ؟
8 years experience  without documentation at all is not something good to say.

Alaa New I do not think so , i think he needed that Full stack one with the joomle and docs :) BTW i am not talking about accepting me -as i really did not apply/want the job-  i am talking about rudeness in ending the interview :)

when i was showing him an example of my work : it is a big site to be launched soon , something wrong happened in the site , he behaved as if he is the winner of the great cup saying " this seems to be buggy code full of bugs .. alot of bugs " .. i tried to stop laughing .. but i could not ... i really do not know why did he behave like this :)

Fouad Abd ELrazek , Diaa Radwan i think i was clear enough, i said i can document , but i did not do any documentation because i was not asked before , my team always had that person who is responsible for docs. i was explaining to them and they were doing all the job.
بالنسبة للدوكمنتشن ماظنش اشتغلت في شركة وكان في دوكس لاي حاجة :]

انا بقالى 14 سنة مبرمج ما شفتش كده :)

Arabs Knight حتى لو ياباشا محدش بيفهم الكود زى اللى كتبه
انت شخصيا ممكن تكتب كود و ترجعله بعد فترة متفهموش او تنسي ال logic

الموضوع مش معقد أوى زى ما أنت بتتكلم أوى ... دول شوية كلاسات بتكتب بيعملوا أيه و الفنكشن بتاعة كل دالة فيهم أيه و ال API شغال إزاى و الداتابيز متصممه إزاى ... شوية كلام أى حد يعملهم أثناء شغل المشروع .. الشركات اللى اشتغلت معاهم بيحبوا الإنجاز و مبيحبوش يعطلونا فى اى حاجه .. اللى بيكتب الدوكس بيكون شغال زى التيستر كل شويه على دماغك بيسألك عن شوية حاجات .. و أنت ترد على السريع و هو يروح يكتب و يظبط الدنيا .. دا الشغل البروفيشنال .. أنما بقى الشغل بتاع تكتب شوية كود و بعدين تقعد تشرح و تعمل .. هتفصل و مش هتخلص
Arabs Knight Well, It's Huge.
Anyone can be sloppy, even a multinational company, but be careful because some Egyptians can claim to be a multinational company just because they have an English or French name :)

A question about your last comment, Arabs Knight, the professional way is to have someone else write the documentation about *your* code, after you spend the time explaining what your code does? 

So, a dedicated full time person, plus the time you spend explaining > just writing docs as you go?

I really cannot wrap my head around this, and never have I heard of this being a common practice.

Just before we start getting hot headed, the best practice in my humble experience is to have the code be self documenting, and the documentation can be generated either with a code generator or some other tool when needed. The documentation produced by a human should just be the main structure and the patterns used. the rest can be produced by a machine if the code is written properly.
That's a great point.

Ahmed Al-Amir , Muhammad AlHaqqani .. i agree with you , if it is just some thing to write and go .

Sometimes Clients require fully Documented product with every method and response explained and every variable type and value expected .. specially when applications are required for banking or communication companies ...

Ahmed Al-Amir ... The code is 90% understood so the person returns me just in some cases he wanna make sure of ... he could be a programmer or have a coding background .

we write comments on our code as directions for him too.

Guys , i am taking here about heavy duty documentation .. not the usual ones , where you could generate or fulfill in 3 pages :)
Uh-ha, so that is along the lines of "project documentation". Usually when saying documentation one's mind goes to code/technical docs.
Agile documentation :) Bad ASS and Mind blowing
Btw, did they actually ask to see a running project or just take a peek at code that you have written? The former would be very intrusive of them IMHO.
if we are talking about code, method, variables, generators can do that a lot better than humans. If we are talking about usage scenarios and how tos then a video is better
Muhammad AlHaqqani Work flow , Project contracts , Client requirements , Our Suggestions , Changes , Updates , Future plans , Technical docs , Design docs. ... the Whole big Documentation process
